0.name: An elegantly Chiseled Hallway
desc: "   Where the rest of Fortrum is a marvel of carved passageways and rooms,
this hall could not be more different.  And not in a bad way.  The very
floors upon which you tread have been carved so finely that they tell the
tale of Fortrus, the Founder, and his trials as he led his people to the
mountain.  No wonder this hall was hidden so well, for it is clearly not
for the eyes of any outsider.

exits.info: door, pickproof, autoclose, autolock, locked, closed

1.name: The Juncture in the Hall of Smiths
desc: "   The tale of Fortrus continues you here.  It seems that the old grey beard
had made a choice at this point.  The story tells that he fashioned himself a
shield and then a hammer.  He took these mighty artefacts to the top of the
mountain and thereupon he drew up the runes of power, infusing his devices
in the name of protecting his people.  And here the juncture leads to an a
working armoury, a working weaponsmith and to the very rune forge of Fortrus
himself, where the Thunderhammer was said to have been made.  No Dwarf out-
side of Fortrum would ever see this spectacle.

2.name: The Weapon Forge
desc: "   In the corner of this room a mighty forge bellows forth heat at a
temperature far exceeding that of a volcano.  Dwarves work diligently
under the watchful gaze of the forge master, crafting and creating
works unrivalled in all the realms.

3.name: The Armour Forge
desc: "   In the corner of this room a mighty forge bellows forth heat at a
temperature far exceeding that of a volcano.  Dwarves work diligently
under the watchful gaze of the forge master, crafting and creating
works unrivalled in all the realms.

4.name: The Rune Forge
desc: "   In the corner of this room a mighty forge bellows forth heat at a
temperature far exceeding that of a volcano.  Dwarves work diligently
under the watchful gaze of the forge master, crafting and creating
works unrivalled in all the realms.

5.name: A Spiral Stairway
desc: "   Hewn from the rock, each stair in this wide, grand stairway has been
expertly carved to tell a tale of the heroics of the Dwarves of Fortrum.
Here the stairs and surrounding walls and ceiling recount the legend of
Bahl, and how he grew to give birth to two sons.  One being the famed
Odin and the other Surtur.  The tale continues that Surtur was thrown
out of Fortrum, banished by Bahl for a crime that doesn't appear to be
mentioned anywhere.  The stairs continue down or back up to the forges.

6.name: Further up (or down) the Spiral Stairway
desc: "   The amazing carvings on the stairs, walls and ceiling continue here.
And so do the stories that they depict!  In this part of the stairway the
legends turn to Hela.  She was the daughter of Odin who grew to rival him
in power.  She fell in love with Surtur and between them they gave birth
to two sons, Loki and Fafnir.  When Bahl learned of this he banished Hela
and Surtur and made to put a curse of their sons, but Hela hid Loki from
Bahl's eyes and saved him.  Sadly, she was too slow to save Fafnir, and
the curse took hold, forever removing Surtur and Hela from their second
son.  The stairs continue up and down.

7.name: The base of the Spiral Stairway
desc: "   This is the bottom of the stairs.  The grand, elegant carvings are
as vivid here as they are everywhere else in this section of Fortrum.
There are massive, stone doors here leading west, north and south.
Each door is protected by glowing, golden runes that seem to convey a
sense of anti-magic.  Whatever is beyond these dread portals is most
likely unfriendly and ready for battle.  Be wary of tricks!
#{bold}You step gingerly through the shimmering, swirling portal...!#{off}

40.name: A Back Passageway
desc: "  This appears to be a connecting passageway. Cramped, dimly lit..
not comfortable at all. The only exits are to the east and an opening
which has been carved in the floor. The floor doesn't seem very stable.

extra.desc: The floor caves in and you fall!

41.name: A Back Passageway
desc: "  This appears to be a connecting passageway. Cramped, dimly lit..
not comfortable at all. The only exits are to the north and an opening
which has been carved in the floor. The floor doesn't seem very stable.

extra.desc: The floor caves in and you fall!

50.name: A Set of Stone Steps
desc: "  There is a passage with some steps here, carved out of the stone. They
are fairly steep, but it looks like you can make it up the safely. Trying
to go down them might prove challenging.
50.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

51.name: On the Stone Steps
desc: "  As you climb the steps, you start to worry about how you will get down
them. The passageway is getting a little tight. It was obviously not carved
for someone of your stature.
51.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

52.name: On the Stone Steps
desc: "  As you climb the steps, you start to worry about how you will get down
them. The passageway is getting a little tight. It was obviously not carved
for someone of your stature.
52.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

53.name: Before a Finely Carved Home
desc: "  You stand before a lovely dwarven home. The occupant must be held in
fairly high regard by the city of Fortrum. The area is very private. A
warm glow radiates from the home, illuminating the passageway.
53.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

54.name: Before a Finely Carved Home
desc: "  You stand before a lovely dwarven home. The occupant must be held in
fairly high regard by the city of Fortrum. The area is very private. A
warm glow radiates from the home, illuminating the passageway.

extra.desc: You lose your footing and tumble down the steps!

55.name: On the Stone Steps
desc: "  As you climb the steps, you start to worry about how you will get down
them. The passageway is getting a little tight. It was obviously not carved
for someone of your stature.

extra.desc: You bang your head!

56.name: On the Stone Steps
desc: "  As you climb the steps, you start to worry about how you will get down
them. The passageway is getting a little tight. It was obviously not carved
for someone of your stature.
56.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, dispel_magic

57.name: A Cozy Bedroom
desc: "  It is a tight squeeze in here. If you were the size of a dwarf, this
bedroom looks like it would be very comfortable and soothing. Family
pictures adorn the walls, and a comfy reading chair sits in the corner
of the room.

60.name: A Large Set of Steps
desc: "  Another large passageway has been carved out here. Some steps lead down.
There is a bit of water dripping from the ceiling. The steps appear a little
slippery, which could prove to be dangerous.

extra.desc: Your feel slip out from beneath you!

61.name: On the Large Steps
desc: "  These steps are large enough to accomodate your size. You begin to
wonder how big the dwarf must be that requires such large steps.

extra.desc: You bang your head!

62.name: On the Large Steps
desc: "  These steps are large enough to accomodate your size. You begin to
wonder how big the dwarf must be that requires such large steps.
62.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, dispel_magic

63.name: Before a Large Dwarven Home
desc: "  A very large home has been carved out here. The dwarf that could afford
such a home must have a very lucrative career. Upon further inspection,
the house doesn't appear that inviting. Perhaps you should have announced
your visit instead of showing up unannounced.
Drong sees you milling around outside his home, grabs you by the collar and shouts,
"Well, if you wanna come in so bad, come on in!"

70.name: A Summoning Room
desc: "  You have obviously accidently entered one of Morina's many summoning
rooms. As a cleric, Morina prides herself on this talent. Unfortunately
for you, many dangerous things can sometimes be found in such rooms.
70.flags: indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort, dispel_magic

71.name: A Summoning Room
desc: "  You have obviously accidently entered one of Morina's many summoning
rooms. As a cleric, Morina prides herself on this talent. Unfortunately
for you, many dangerous things can sometimes be found in such rooms.
71.flags: indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort, dispel_magic

72.name: A Summoning Room
desc: "  You have obviously accidently entered one of Morina's many summoning
rooms. As a cleric, Morina prides herself on this talent. Unfortunately
for you, many dangerous things can sometimes be found in such rooms.
72.flags: indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort, dispel_magic

73.name: Morina's Prayer Room
desc: "  This room is designed to promote a sense of calmness. You are instantly
struck by an overwhelming feeling of peace and tranquility. If you stay
here for too long, you may fall sound asleep. The chairs are plush and
comfortable. The paintings on the wall are subdued and soothing. The only
exit is back down the stairs towards the main room of Morina's shop.
73.flags: indoors, no_sum, private, fast_mana, fast_hit_points, fast_moves, mapable, relocate_distort

75.name: A Portaling Room
desc: "  You have entered one of Auor's portalling rooms. As a mage, this is a
talent she takes great pride in. The powerful magic used for this spell
seems to have changed the rooms physical properties. There is no exit in
the direction from which you entered. The only way out appears to be
through one of Auor's magical portals.

76.name: A Portaling Room
desc: "  You have entered one of Auor's portalling rooms. As a mage, this is a
talent she takes great pride in. The powerful magic used for this spell
seems to have changed the rooms physical properties. There is no exit in
the direction from which you entered. The only way out appears to be
through one of Auor's magical portals.

77.name: Auor's Secret Portaling Room
desc: "  You have entered Auor's private portalling room. From what you see,
Auor must be some type of spy for Fortrum. There are several portals here,
all slightly different in appearance. This must allow her to keep up with
the happenings around the realms. Perhaps this is how the Fortrum Dwarves
seem to be so prepared for any conflict. There is a chalkboard on the
northern wall.  Some notes have been scribbled on it.
swirling ----> Terberthia
misty ----> Chaos
cloudy ----> Nasis (taken down - something is going on with Nasis?)
glowing ----> Greece
shimmering ----> Abyss

exits.info: door, closed, locked, secret, pickproof, hidden, autoclose, autolock

80.name: The Bottom of a Rope Ladder
desc: "  You are at the top of a sturdy rope ladder. The ropes appear to be new.
The rungs look strong. This ladder must undergo regular maintenance.
80.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

81.name: On a Rope Ladder
desc: "   As you scale the ladder, you momentarily lose your footing. However,
you are able to correct yourself and continue unscathed. The ladder
continues both up and down, obviously.
81.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

82.name: On a Rope Ladder
desc: As you continue on the ladder, you begin to wonder if this was such a
wise idea. The ladder continues both up and down, obviously.
82.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

83.name: Outside an Enourmous Dwarven Home
desc: "  Before you stands the largest private dwarven home you have seen in
Fortrum. The owner of such a palace must be revered by the community.
You start to wonder if a suprise visit by anyone, let alone an outsider,
is going to be deemed appropriate.
83.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

85.name: The Bottom of a Rope Ladder
desc: "  You are at the bottom of a sturdy rope ladder. The ropes appear to be
new. The rungs look strong. This ladder must undergo regular maintenance.
85.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

86.name: On a Rope Ladder
desc: "   As you scale the ladder, you momentarily lose your footing. However,
you are able to correct yourself and continue unscathed. The ladder
continues both up and down, obviously.
86.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

87.name: On a Rope Ladder
desc: As you continue on the ladder, you begin to wonder if this was such a
wise idea. The ladder continues both up and down, obviously.
87.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

88.name: Outside an Exquisitely Carved Home
desc: "  You can't even imagine the time and dedication it took to carve out such
a home. The gifted crafstmanship is staggering. This is obviously the home
of a dwarf that has set themself apart from the rest in some way. A small
pet dragon is curled up here, standing guard. Perhaps you should have
told the owner that you would be stopping by.
88.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

92.name: A Grand and Imposing Gate
desc: "  As you pass through the gate, you notice the fantastic craftsmanship
that went into its design. Functionally sound and able to serve its main
purpose of protection with ease, the artisan who created this gate obviously
cared a great deal about how it looked as well. The gate is adorned with the
symbols of the various Fortish clans. The main symbol of the Fortrum Empire
is showcased very imposingly in the gate's center.

extra.desc: "  Thank goodness.  A stone platform!  All that swaying was going to make you hurl.
"  The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

93.name: Across a Magestic Marble Bridge
desc: "  This magestic marble bridge was obviously crafted by a very talented
Fortish stone mason. Although many centuries old, it's beauty has survived
the passage of time. Looking off the bridge and down into the valley below,
it is apparent that a fall from here would be the end of your journey. The
bridge ends to the north at a solid stone wall. The south end of the bridge
connects to a large stone platform.

extra.desc: "  Thank goodness.  A stone platform!  All that swaying was going to make you hurl.
"  The sturdy rope bridge sways gently with each footstep.

100.name: Before the Archway
desc: "  You are standing before a giant archway carved into the wall. The
impenetrable fortress of Fortrum lies beyond. The fortress was designed
to stop invaders from marching on the city beyond. Luckily for you, the
giant metal gate is wide open. The dwarves must not currently be at war.

101.name: Under the Archway
desc: "   You are standing under a giant archway carved into the wall. There
was a time when outsiders would not have been able to get within a
hundred miles of this dwarven fortress. You can go north, and enter the
fortress. Or, you could go south and leave the dwarven stronghold.

102.name: Alongside a Huge Wall
desc: "  There is a staircase to the east, which appears to lead to the top of
the fortress wall.  The wall currently looks unguarded, like the rest
of the fortress.

103.name: Stairs Alongside a Huge wall
desc: "  As you climb the wall stairs, you admire the craftsmanship of this
fortress. What a perfectly designed stronghold, easily defendable. This
race has a talent for all things related to war that is quite remarkable.

104.name: Stairs Alongside a Huge wall
desc: "  As you climb the wall stairs, you admire the craftsmanship of this
fortress. What a perfectly designed stronghold, easily defendable. This
race has a talent for all things related to war that is quite remarkable.

105.name: On the Western Wall
desc: "   You are standing on the western side of the fortress wall. This wall
has one sole purpose, to keep people out. The builders of this wall were
very keen on protecting their city. From this vantage point, a sneak
attack on the city would be impossible. The wall continues to the north
and south. A stairscase leads down.

106.name: On the Western Wall
desc: "   You are standing on the western side of the fortress wall. This wall

108.name: The Mountain Face
desc: "   The wall comes to an abrubt end at the sheer face of the mountain.

desc: "  As you climb the wall stairs, you admire the craftsmanship of this

121.name: Stairs Alongside a Huge wall
desc: "  As you climb the wall stairs, you admire the craftsmanship of this
fortress. What a perfectly designed stronghold, easily defendable. This
race has a talent for all things related to war that is quite remarkable.

122.name: Alongside a Huge Wall
desc: "  There is a staircase to the east, which appears to lead to the top of
the fortress wall.  The wall currently looks unguarded, like the rest
of the fortress.

123.name: Within the Fortress Wall
desc: "  The dwarven fortress of Fortrum is quite a sight to behold. Excellent
craftsmanship partnered with a keen insight for defense. No wonder the
city beyond has survived for centuries. The dwarves have perfected the
art of war down to a science.

125.name: Path Towards the Mountain
desc: "  This narrow path snakes north, towards the towering mountain. You have
heard that outsiders have become more common in the dwarven city. It was
not always so. Perhaps you will be able to see some of the legendary
battle gear up close.

126.name: Path Towards the Mountain
desc: "  This narrow path snakes north, towards the towering mountain. You have
heard that outsiders have become more common in the dwarven city. It was
not always so.  You can follow the path north or south. Small carved out
rooms also sit to the east and west.

127.name: A Dwarven Training Facility
desc: "  A dwarven guildmaster has been stationed here to help those in training.
Over the centuries, he has been involved in many epic battles. He decided
to spend his golden years living in the relative peace found in Fortrum city.

128.name: The Infirmary
desc: "  You don't see many dwarves in the infirmary at the moment. However,
you are sure it has seen alot of action over the centuries. The Fortish
battles are legendary.

129.name: Before a Chiseled Staircase
desc: "  The snaking path ends at a steep staircase carved into the mountain
itself. It is very steep, and very intimidating. You can traverse the
staircase, or proceed south, down the snaking path.

130.name: Giant Steps Carved into the Mountain
desc: "   The steps are quite steep, making them somewhat difficult to climb.
Further ahead, at the top of the staircase, you see a magnificent archway.

131.name: Giant Steps Carved into the Mountain
desc: "   The steps are quite steep, making them somewhat difficult to climb.
Further ahead, at the top of the staircase, you see a magnificent archway.

132.name: Before a Chiseled Archway
desc: "   You are standing before a giant archway carved into the mountain.
You see the flicker of a torch illuminate the walls deeper within the
passageway ahead.

133.name: Under a Chiseled Archway
desc: "   You are starting to feel somewhat insignificant standing under such
an enormous archway. The size appears to be a not so sublte form of
intimidation. The dwarves are nothing if not a proud race.

134.name: Inside the Mountain
desc: "   As you step into the mountain, you notice a slight decrease in
temperature. Further to the north, the torch light becomes more visible.
Your eyes start to adjust to the new lighting conditions.

135.name: Entrance to the Underground City
desc: "   The entrance to the dwarven city of Fortrum opens up here. Tunnels and
passageways lead of in every direction. This area looks like is was carved
out long ago.

136.name: A Finely Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   Someone took a lot of pride in carving out this passageway. It is much
less rough cut than the others in this mountain. Some symbols adorn the
walls. They are not etched in, but rather prodrude out. You make note of
three which are very distinct and repeat often. One lines the wall to the
east. Another can be seen on the western wall. And, the third repeats on
the wall above your head.

137.name: A Finely Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   Someone took a lot of pride in carving out this passageway. It is much
less rough cut than the others in this mountain. Some symbols adorn the
walls. They are not etched in, but rather prodrude out. You make note of
three which are very distinct and repeat often. One lines the wall to the
east. Another can be seen on the western wall. And, the third repeats on
the wall above your head.

armor adorned with the symbols you have seen lining the walls. Some very
proud and important dwarves must be further along this path.

154.name: Council Chambers of the Clans' Elders
desc: "  You are standing in one of the largest chamber rooms you have ever seen.
Symbols, banners, and weapons adorn all the walls of this great meeting place.
A large table sits directly in the room's center. Although enormous, the table
sits quite low to the ground.

160.name: A Finely Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   Someone took a lot of pride in carving out this passageway. It is much
less rough cut than the others in this mountain. Some symbols adorn the
walls. They are not etched in, but rather prodrude out. Unlike the other
passageways, only one symbol seems to repeat here. It also appears much
larger and in greater detail. A carved blue door blocks the way east.

161.name: A Finely Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   Someone took a lot of pride in carving out this passageway. It is much
less rough cut than the others in this mountain. Some symbols adorn the
walls. They are not etched in, but rather prodrude out. Unlike the other
passageways, only one symbol seems to repeat here. It also appears much
larger and in greater  detail. A carved blue door blocks the way west.

162.name: Gorak's War Room
desc: "   This is the war room of Gorak, the blue clan Warchief. In this room,
many strategic military decisions are made. You will commonly find Gromm
here several times throughout any given day. The tables and walls are
covered with maps and battle plans for, what appears to be, an upcoming,
large scale conflict.

163.name: Gammel's Chamber of Transcendental Meditation
desc: "   Gammel's chamber is where he meditates about the future of his clan,
from a spiritual and theological standpoint. He is often found kneeling
in front of the altar, silently asking the ancient dieties to help and
guide his people through times of conflict, and deliver them to peace.

164.name: Bazel's Chambers
desc: "  Bazel's chambers are suprisingly humble and unassuming for one of the
most powerful dwarves in all of Fortrum. In Fortrum, the elders are
revered. Bazel is looked to for guidance in all manner of things. He is
not feared, but rather sumpremely admired, honored, and respected. His
words are not orders, but are followed as such. They are not followed
because they have to be. They are followed because they should be.

165.name: A Finely Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   Someone took a lot of pride in carving out this passageway. It is much
less rough cut than the others in this mountain. Some symbols adorn the
walls. They are not etched in, but rather prodrude out. Unlike the other
passageways, only one symbol seems to repeat here. It also appears much
larger and in greater  detail. A carved red door blocks the way south.

desc: "   Morral's chamber is where she contemplates over the future of her clan,
from a spiritual and theological perspective. She is often found kneeling
in front of the altar, silently asking the ancient dieties to help and
guide her people through times of conflict, and deliver them to peace.

168.name: Groth's War Room
desc: "  This is the war room of Groth, the red clan Warchief. In this room, many
strategic military decisions are made. You will commonly find both Drong
and Grimlag here several times in the course of any given day. Although
Drong is included in meetings, it is no secret that Groth favors Grimlag's
commanding technique.

175.name: A Finely Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   Someone took a lot of pride in carving out this passageway. It is much
less rough cut than the others in this mountain. Some symbols adorn the

200.name: Entering the City
desc: "   You descend deeper into the mountain, towards the dwarven city of
Fortrum. You wonder if all the tales of the city are true. The sloping
passageway looks like it was tunneled long ago.

201.name: Deep Within Fortrum
desc: "   You are now deep within the mountain city of Fortrum. Although these
dwarves are known for their incredible appetites for drinking and
fighting, you are certain no advancing army could penetrate this far into
their city. The cavern opens up to the north. You hear the sounds of the
city echoing throughout this area.
201.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

202.name: A Grand Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   This area is huge. Calling it a passageway doesn't begin to do it
justice. The underground city of Fortrum opens up before you. It must
have taken centuries for the dwarves to carve this city out of the
mountain's depths. The city is a little cold, but not unbearable. All
around you dwarves are going about their business. They do not seem too
conerned about your presence, although you do notice an occasional look
shot in your general direction.

203.name: A Guard Post
desc: "  A shallow nook has been created in the wall here.  It is very small, and
you have to crouch down to keep from knocking your head into the mountain.
This appears to be another guard post. These dwarves are serious about
the defense of their beloved city.

204.name: A Guard Post

206.name: A Dwarven Shop
desc: "  Various dwarven essentials line the shelves of this small shop. The
clerk appears to be very busy with all the customer traffic. The owner
must be doing good business.

209.name: An Inn
desc: "  The inn is quaintly decorated and unassuming. Your things would probably
be very safe here, should you decide to take some well deserved rest.
209.flags: no_mob, indoors, peaceful, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

210.name: Auor's Shop
desc: "  This is the shop of Auor, the dwarven mage. Everything you see in this
shop is designed to either increase the fighting prowess of her dwarven
patrons, or or to weaken their enemies. A freshly created portal shimmers
in the back of the shop. It seems to almost blink in and out of existence.
Auor equally divides her time between tending to her shop, and exploring
the distant reaches of this world and others.
210.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

shot in your general direction.

212.name: Dwarven Tavern
desc: "  The taverns are obvioulsy the hubs of activity in Fortrum. The noise
is a little overwhelming. Dwarves are constantly coming and going. Every
dwarf in the place is either yelling, laughing, or passed out.
212.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

213.name: Dwarven Weaponsmith
desc: "  The weaponsmith is here banging away at something. He seems very focused
on whatever it is he is working on. The room is meticulously arranged.
There are various projects here, all neatly organized and labeled for
later comletion and delivery.
213.flags: no_mob, indoors, peaceful, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

214.name: The Main Square in Fortrum
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of Fortrum's main square. You have
never seen this many dwarves in your life. The city overwhelms your
senses. All of the noise echoes around this great chamber. You hear the
constant clanging of a blacksmith. Drunken dwarves stumble out of the
tavern. Every so often you notice a fight break out, but often they end
in drunken laughter. The smell of roasting meat floats through the air.
This city definitely has a character all its own.

217.name: Tavern Owner's House
desc: "  As you pass through the back door of the tavern, you realize that you
have entered the owner's place of residence. There is a pleasant warmth
radiating from a small fireplace in the back wall. A chimney must have
been carved all the way up through the mountain.
217.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

220.name: A Dwarven Home
desc: "  Weapons and armor line the wall of this otherwise scantily decorated
home. The city noise fades into the background as you move further into
the room. This house either belongs to a warrior, or an avid collector
of weapons.
220.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

225.name: End of the Passageway
desc: "   You have come to the end of the passageway. The hustle and bustle of
the city is more subdued in this area. A portion of the mountain wall is
carved out in such a way to leave room for future expansion. There are
steps to the north and south. Far back to the west is Fortrum's main
square.

226.name: The Home of Drong
desc: "  A battle commander for the red clan, Drong prides himself on the fact
that his planned battles have consistently resulted in very low dwarven
causalties. This priority is somewhat in conflict with that of his direct
superior, Grimlag.
226.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

227.name: The Home Of Bolim
desc: "  This is the home of Bolim, a scout for the red clan. Although a scout
for more years than Hildr, he has not proven himself to be nearly as
talented. This fact causes some resentment, and is somewhat of a strain
on their professional relationship.
227.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

229.name: Dwarven Blacksmith
desc: "  The blacksmith is here banging away at something. He seems very focused
on whatever he is working on. The room is littered with projects in various
stages of completion. This dwarf appears to have a system, it is just very
hard to figure out quite what it is.
229.flags: no_mob, indoors, peaceful, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

232.name: Morina's Shop
desc: "  The shelves of this shop are lined with various healing salves and
potions. Morina, the dwarven cleric, prides herself at keeping her patrons
in good health. You can see her summoning rooms off in almost every
direction. Some stairs lead up to a very peaceful looking room. Morina's
customers use this room for meditation and prayer.

shot in your general direction. A solid looking door lies to the north.

241.name: A Narrow Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   The mountain closes in on you a bit in this passageway. Obviously

passageway continues to the east and west.

259.name: Weaponsmith's House
desc: "  As you pass through the back door of the weaponsmith's shop, you realize
that you have entered his place of residence. There is a pleasant warmth
radiating from a small fireplace in the back wall. A chimney must have been
carved all the way up through the mountain.
259.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

260.name: Tavern Owner's House
desc: "  As you pass through the back door of the tavern, you realize that you
have entered the owner's place of residence. There is a pleasant warmth
radiating from a small fireplace in the back wall. A chimney must have
been carved all the way up through the mountain.

262.name: A Dwarven Home
desc: "  Weapons and armor line the wall of this otherwise scantily decorated
home. The city noise fades into the background as you move further into
the room. This house either belongs to a warrior, or an avid collector
of weapons.
262.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

267.name: End of the Passageway
desc: "   You have come to the end of the passageway. The hustle and bustle of
the city is more subdued in this area. A portion of the mountain wall is
carved out in such a way to leave room for future expansion. There are
rooms to the north and south. Far back to the west is Fortrum's main
square.

268.name: The Home of Grimlag
desc: "  This is the home of Grimlag, head battle commander for the red clan.
Grimlag's top prioroty is victory, regardless of how many die under his
command. Although this philosophy has served the dwarves well over the
years, progressive thinkers such as Drong are viewed as the future of
this dwarven city.
268.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

269.name: The Home of Hildr
desc: "   Hildr, the head scout for the red clan, is a relatively young dwarf
to hold such a lofty position. Highly motivated and extremely talented,
she is held in contempt by some of those under her command. This is a fact
that has never seemed to bother her.
269.flags: no_mob, indoors, no_sum, private, mapable, relocate_distort

270.name: Entering the City
desc: "   You descend deeper into the mountain, towards the dwarven city of
Fortrum. You wonder if all the tales of the city are true. The sloping
passageway looks like it was tunneled long ago.

283.name: In Fortrum City
desc: "   You are now within the mountain city of Fortrum. Although these
dwarves are known for their incredible appetites for drinking and
fighting, you are certain no advancing army could penetrate this far into
their city. The cavern opens up to the north. You hear the sounds of the
city echoing throughout this area.

284.name: A Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   The granite has been carved away to create a very comfortably sized
passageway. This multi-level city is like nothing you have ever seen.
Noises of the city echo around the entire cavern. All around you dwarves
are going about their daily business. They do not seem too concerned about
your presence, although you do notice an occasional look shot in your
general direction.

285.name: A Guard Post
desc: "  A shallow nook has been created in the wall here.  It is very small, and
you have to crouch down to keep from knocking your head into the mountain.
This appears to be another guard post. These dwarves are serious about
the defense of their beloved city.

desc: "  Various dwarven essentials line the shelves of this small shop. The

294.name: An Empty Shop
desc: "  This place looks like it is in transition between shopkeepers. The previous

295.name: Dwarven Tavern
desc: "  The taverns are obvioulsy the hubs of activity in Fortrum. The noise
is a little overwhelming. Dwarves are constantly coming and going. Every
dwarf in the place is either yelling, laughing, or passed out.

296.name: Fortrum Intersection
desc: "   The passageway intersects here, forming a modest town square. Most
of the activity seems to revolve around the tavern. You wonder if these
dwarves do anything besides drink and fight. There is also an armoury.

305.name: The Home of Gromm
desc: "   This is the home of Gromm, head battle commander for the blue clan.
Although the decor is pleasant, you get the feeling that this dwarf is
quite certainly a bachelor. The heads of several large game animals are
mounted on the walls.

306.name: The Home of Toogal
desc: "  Toogal's home is slightly more ornate than some of the other dwarven
homes you have visited. Apparently Toogal fancies himself the sophisticated
sort. The position of head scout may have gone to the head of this blue
clan member.

307.name: Near an Underground Spring
desc: "   There is an underground spring here. Its icy water constantly rushes
past you. The chiseled passageway goes off to the east.

311.name: Dwarven Armoury
desc: "  The armourer is here banging away at something. You have never seen such

weapons..... this guy has it all.

passageway. This multi-level city is like nothing you have ever seen.
Noises of the city echo around the entire cavern. All around you dwarves
are going about their daily business. They do not seem too concerned about
your presence, although you do notice an occasional look shot in your
general direction.

372.name: A Dwarven Home
desc: "  Weapons and armor line the wall of this otherwise scantily decorated
home. The city noise fades into the background as you move further into
the room. This house either belongs to a warrior, or an avid collector
of weapons.

377.name: The Home of Kragg
desc: "  This is the home of Kragg, head battle commander for the green clan.
Books, maps, and scrolls line the walls from floor to ceiling. This dwarf
takes his position quite seriously.

378.name: The Home of Orek
desc: "  This is the home of Orek, head scout of the green clan. It is apparent
that Orek is a humble dwarf. Furnishing are meager, but the home is
kept in meticulous condition.

379.name: Near an Underground Spring
desc: "   There is an underground spring here. Its icy water constantly rushes
past you. The chiseled passageway goes off to the west.

extra.desc: You lose your footing and fall in the spring!

380.name: A Rushing Underground Spring
desc: "   The water is frigid! You can't stay in here for very long.
You can barely make out a small hole in the cave wall.

381.name: A Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   The granite has been carved away to create a very comfortably sized
passageway. This multi-level city is like nothing you have ever seen.
Noises of the city echo around the entire cavern. All around you dwarves

your presence, although you do notice an occasional look shot in your
general direction.

382.name: Dwarven Shop
desc: "  It appears that this is the one shop in all of Fortrum that will cater
to outsiders. The shopkeeper greets you with a friendly smile. Maybe you
should buy something while you have the chance.

383.name: An Empty Shop
desc: "  This place looks like it is in transition between shopkeepers. The previous
owner appears to have done a very quick breakdown and an even quicker attempt
at a cleanup. It's a mess in here.

384.name: A Chiseled Passageway
desc: "   The granite has been carved away to create a very comfortably sized

general direction.

385.name: A Dwarven Shop
desc: "  Various dwarven essentials line the shelves of this small shop. The
clerk appears to be very busy with all the customer traffic. The owner
must be doing good business.

391.name: A Guard Post
desc: "  A shallow nook has been created in the wall here.  It is very small, and
you have to crouch down to keep from knocking your head into the mountain.
This appears to be another guard post. These dwarves are serious about
the defense of their beloved city.

393.name: A Hole
desc: "  You squeeze into the tiny hole in the cavern wall. The mist from the
spring makes it hard to see anything. You sense something in the cave
cave beyond. Your eyes begin to adjust...

396.name: A Small Cave
desc: "  This cave is not much bigger than the hole you squeezed through to get
here. Your hair and clothes are damp from the mist. It smells pretty bad
in here.
